content:
Diagnosis:
Metastatic undifferentiated carcinoma of unknown primary origin

Previous treatment:
Completed 6 cycles carboplatin/etoposide March-August 2023

Current medications:
Dexamethasone 4mg daily
Zolendronic acid monthly
Oxycodone MR 20mg BD

Allergies:
None known

Current situation:
End of treatment review following completion of first-line chemotherapy

I reviewed [redacted name] today following completion of 6 cycles carboplatin/etoposide. The treatment was generally well tolerated with only grade 1-2 fatigue and occasional nausea. CT scan on 15/8/23 shows stable disease in liver metastases and no new sites of disease. Bone scan confirms stable appearances of skeletal metastases. Performance status remains 1.

Symptoms are currently well controlled on current analgesic regime. Mobility has improved with physiotherapy input and bone pain is significantly better following radiotherapy and ongoing bisphosphonates.

The plan is for regular surveillance with 3-monthly CT scans and clinic review. First follow-up arranged for November 2023 with CT scan beforehand. [redacted name] understands to contact us sooner if new symptoms develop. Written information provided regarding signs/symptoms that should prompt earlier review.

cancer_timeline.value: CT scan shows stable disease in liver metastases and no new sites of disease
Bone scan confirms stable appearances of skeletal metastases

patient_facts.value: Bone pain - improved and well controlled on current analgesics

status_updates.value: Metastatic undifferentiated carcinoma with stable disease following completion of first-line chemotherapy. Symptoms well controlled.
Grade 1-2 fatigue and occasional nausea during chemotherapy
Stable disease on CT and bone scan with symptom improvement
Clinic review in November 2023 with 3-monthly follow-up plan
